Don&#039;t trust a soul. 

John Hobbes watches Edgar Reese, a convicted murderer Hobbes brought 
to justice, get executed. Reese dies with great bravado, and then a 
series of murders are committed using Reese&#039;s methods. As Hobbes follows 
up the last clues Reese left, we see an evil presence move from person 
to person by touch. Hobbes comes closer and closer to the secret as the 
presence taunts him more and more openly, threatening everyone Hobbes 
holds dear in the world.
